revised_title: The Flow of Air and Fluid Around Aerofoils and Elliptic Cylinders
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the flow of air and fluid around aerofoils and elliptic cylinders, focusing on the forward stagnation point. They found that the stagnation point for an inviscid flow does not always agree with that measured in a wind tunnel, and the differences increase with the magnitude of the circulation. The pressure distribution in the immediate vicinity of the stagnation point and over a large part of the nose is more closely represented by theory when using the circulation that makes the stagnation points coincide.
